dct_title_s: Navigatio ac itinerarium Iohannis Hugonis Linscotani in orientalem sive Lusitanorum Indiam, descriptiones eiusdem terræ ac tractuum littoralium
dct_alternative_sm: Navigatio ac itinerarivm Iohannis Hvgonis Linscotani in orientalem sive Lvsitanorum Indiam, descriptiones eivsdem terræ ac tractvvm littoralivm
dct_description_sm: Abridged Latin translation of Itinerario, voyage ofte schipvaert, Amsterdam, Cornelis Claesz, 1596; Latin translation originally published in the Hague, 1599.
Includes index: Index seu elenchus itinerarii.
Gold-leafed seals on front and back covers.
First 2 and last 2 pages blank (included in page description).
Engraved, hand-colored title pages, head-pieces throughout, illustrations of indigenous peoples, flora and fauna (with explanations), portrait of Linschoten.

Title page for second section: Descriptio totius Guinea tractus, Congi, Angolae, et Monomotapae, eorumque locorum, quae e regione C. S. Augustini in Brasilia jacent ; proprietates oceani ; insularumq́ue eiusdem, S. Thomæ, S. Helenæ, Ascensionis &c. portuum, altitudinis, Syrrium, vadorum, ac fundi ; miræ narrationes navigationum Batavorum, cum interioris terræ descriptione ... Accedit noviter historia navigatonum Batavorum in septentrionales oras, Poliqué Arctici tractus, cum Freti Vaygats detectione summâ side relata / Hagæ-Comitis, ex officinâ Alberti Henrici ; anno 1599.
Decorative borders and cartouches, compass roses, rhumb lines, bar scales, coats of arms.
Maps show topography, vegetation, waterways, shoals, ports, routes.
Illustrations of topography, cities, figures, flora, fauna (e.g. unicorns, Map 2), ships, sea monsters.
Map 1 is a bird's eye view; Maps 3, 4, 5 are views.
Dutch translations of titles on maps.
dct_creator_sm: Doetichum, Johan van, the younger, active 1592-1630
dct_rights_sm: Images from the The Renaissance Exploration Collection courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
